metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1339 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.Description:
Memory leak in the cuse_channel_release function in fs/fuse/cuse.c in theLinux kernel before 4.4 allows local users to cause a denial of service(memory consumption) or possibly have unspecified other impact by opening/dev/cuse many times.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1339` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.2.0-30-generic - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-generic-lpae - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-lowlatency - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-powerpc-e500mc - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-powerpc-smp - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-powerpc64-emb - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-4.2.0-30-powerpc64-smp - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.2.0-30-generic - 4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-lts-wily package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.0-30.35~14.04.1').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-13.29~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
